fields_of_interest: Agriculture, Environment, Single market, Research and innovation, Food Safety
eu_initiatives:
Circular economy 
 
Bioeconomy 
 
Fertilizers Regulation revision 
 
Europe 2020 strategy 
 
Horizon 2020
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
goals__remit: The European Biostimulant Industry Council (EBIC) promotes the contribution of plant biostimulants to make agriculture more sustainable and resilient and in doing so promotes the growth and development of the European Biostimulant Industry. EBIC was founded in June 2011 as the European Biostimulant Industry Consortium and changed its named when it gained legal identity in 2013.
relevant_communication:
February 2017 co-organization of event with DK Perm Rep on biostimulants and EU regulation.  
 
May 2016 sponsorship of an event organized by the EP Intergroup on Climate Change, Biodiversity and Sustainable Development: "New Tools for Farming in the Circular Economy: Creating a Single Market for the Fertilising Products that Farmers Need?" 
 
Participation in numerous workshops at the EP on the draft fertilising products regulation.  
 
Accredited observers to DG GROW's Fertilisers Working Group 
 
Regular meetings with MEPs and Commission officials on relevant policy questions.  
 
Publication of position papers related to relevant policy questions
